intro: Aklema adinophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved karkalla, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with its extensive root system and water-storing tissues. Aklema adinophylla is often found in rocky soils and is a popular choice for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
